climbs.name: Attawapiskat
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes and Amy Cao, June 2021

content.description:
A pleasant little slab route with nice movement on good stone if you stay on route. After the 5th bolt resist the urge to wander right on before heading to the anchor.



Just right of Secret Path. 

5 bolts, bolted anchor

climbs.name: Bonavista
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes and Valerie Anctil, June 2022

content.description:
Start on the low angle slab just right of the Main Wall and Don't Be Jenga. Follow the weakness up the middle then move slightly left to the back of a steeper wall. Climb the corner system to the top moving slightly right to a nice ledge and bolted anchor. Enjoy one of the nice views at GHC.



Right hand side of the cliff.

5 bolts and bolted rappel station. Rap the route.

climbs.name: Pas de la Merde
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes and Valerie Anctil, June 2022

content.description:
Start on a nice slab 5 meters left of Step it Up. Follow the line of bolts up to a nice headwall where you will be treated to a slightly perplexing crux. 



This route is found left of the Poops/Step it Up and right of Bona Vista. 

7 bolts and one fixed nut. Bolted rap station.

First route to the left of Secret Path. Climb up the fist few bolts up and around the arete. Either mantel or climb up left to the left face. Climb the crux face and end on the anchor that is shared with Poop2. 



Bolts, 8 Quickdraws

Climb to the left of poop1 up a sloppy face. Anchor is shared with poop1. 



Bolts, 8 Quickdraws

Just to the right of Step it up. Climb up to the ledge to your first bolt then climb to the second ledge and climb the face of the detached block to the left and finish at the bolted anchor. 



Bolts, 8 Quickdraws

climbs.name: Secret Path
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes and Amy Cao, June 2021

content.description:
A very mellow start on big holds leads you to a gradually steepening open book. Finish on steeper climbing. 



Found on the next formation to the right of the Step it Up face. Secret Path is the first of two routes you will encounter. 

6 bolts, bolted anchor

This climb goes up 3 separate boulder problems stacked on each other. The first boulder problem is protected by 2 bolts, stay left of the first one. On the second ledge stay right of the 3ed bolt. On the final ledge traverse left clip the bolt, and then climb to the left of the last bolt. The hardest boulder problem is height dependent, if you are really tall it could be easy as 10b. This is on a solid piece of slab right of the main wall. 4 bolts + 2 rap rings
This is a sport climb, but if you fell while standing on a big ledge before you clip the bolt, its going to hurt.

The right side is most unstable part of the cliff, there is potential for some new lines but would require a lot of trundling and imagination. There are also a few smaller cliffs the further right you go, some being hidden by trees.
